intro: Hieracium juranum subsp. boltigense, commonly known as the Jura hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
